hints.label: def-ruppeiner-scalar-curvature
hints.title: Ruppeiner Scalar Curvature
hints.content:
2882: :label: def-ruppeiner-scalar-curvature
2883: 
2884: For a 2D metric $g_R$ with line element:
2885: 
2886: $$
2887: ds^2 = g_R^{TT} dT^2 + 2g_R^{TV} dT dV + g_R^{VV} dV^2
2888: $$
2889: 
2890: the **scalar curvature** (Ricci curvature in 2D) is:
2891: 
2892: $$
2893: R_{\text{Rupp}} = -\frac{1}{\sqrt{\det g_R}} \left[\frac{\partial}{\partial T}\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{\det g_R}}\frac{\partial \sqrt{\det g_R}}{\partial T}\right) + \frac{\partial}{\partial V}\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{\det g_R}}\frac{\partial \sqrt{\det g_R}}{\partial V}\right)\right]
2894: $$
2895: 
2896: Equivalently, using the Christoffel symbols $\Gamma^k_{ij}$:
2897: 
2898: $$
2899: R_{\text{Rupp}} = -\frac{1}{\det g_R}\left[\frac{\partial(\sqrt{\det g_R} \Gamma^T_{TT})}{\partial T} + \frac{\partial(\sqrt{\det g_R} \Gamma^V_{VV})}{\partial V} + \text{(mixed terms)}\right]
2900: $$
hints.raw_directive:
2879: For a 2D thermodynamic manifold (e.g., $(T, V)$ plane), the scalar curvature is uniquely determined by the metric.
2880:

2882: :label: def-ruppeiner-scalar-curvature
2883:

2888: $$

2894: $$
2895: 
2896: Equivalently, using the Christoffel symbols $\Gamma^k_{ij}$:

hints.label: unlabeled-example-27
hints.title: Ideal Gas Has Zero Curvature
hints.content:
2906: :class: tip
2907: 
2908: For an ideal gas with $S = Nk_B \ln V + C_V \ln T + \text{const}$ (where $C_V = \frac{3}{2}Nk_B$ for monatomic gas), the Ruppeiner metric in $(T, V)$ coordinates is:
2909: 
2910: $$
2911: g_R = \begin{pmatrix}
2912: \frac{C_V}{T^2} & 0 \\
2913: 0 & \frac{Nk_B}{V^2}
2914: \end{pmatrix}
2915: $$
2916: 
2917: This metric is **non-degenerate** (det $\neq$ 0). Computing the scalar curvature for this 2D metric yields:
2918: 
2919: $$
2920: R_{\text{ideal}} = 0
2921: $$
